meanings.definition: A smokeless explosive powder consisting of nitrocellulose and nitroglycerine.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers loaded their rifles with cordite before heading into battle.
meanings.sent2: The cordite in the ammunition helped propel the bullet forward.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel mistook the cordite for cinnamon and caused chaos in the armory.
meanings.sent4: The cordite exploded with a loud bang, echoing through the valley.
meanings.sent5: The distinct smell of cordite lingered in the air after the explosion.

meanings.definition: A type of propellant used in firearms.
meanings.sent1: Hunters rely on cordite to fire their rifles accurately.
meanings.sent2: The gunsmith recommended using cordite for better shooting performance.
meanings.sent3: The detective found a clue in the cordite residue left at the crime scene.
meanings.sent4: The cordite burned brightly as the bullet shot out of the gun.
meanings.sent5: The sharp crack of the cordite-filled cartridge pierced the silence of the forest.
